get_template()[source]¶

Returns the template set for this section.

set_search_name(section_name, search_name=None)[source]¶

Sets the search name to associate a search class with this section.

set_search_type(section_name, search_type=None)[source]¶

Sets the search type.

If the section name is listed as a search type, the view() method will get the search class from the site_search global and try to search against the search class’ search model.

set_section_list(value=None)[source]¶

Sets the section list.

set_section_name(value=None)[source]¶

Sets the name for this section.

update_context(**kwargs)[source]¶

Updates the template context.

urlpatterns(view=None)[source]¶

Generates urlpatterns for the view of this section.

If this section is associated with a search class registered with site_search global, patterns for search will also be generated.

view(request, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Default view for this section called by _view().

Note

Instead of overriding, try adding to the context using contribute_to_context().

Default context includes::
  • app_name: settings.APP_NAME,
  • installed_apps: settings.INSTALLED_APPS,
  • selected_section: from get_section_name(),
  • sections: from get_section_list(),
  • section_name: from get_section_name(),
  • search_name: from get_search_name() for this section name,
  • sections_using_search: from get_sections_using_search(),
  • search_type: from get_search_type() for this section name,
  • add_model: from get_add_model_cls(),
  • add_model_opts: from get_add_model_opts(),
  • add_model_name: from get_add_model_name(),
  • search_model_admin_url: ‘url’,
  • search_result: search_result,
  • search_result_include_file: search_result_include_file,
